And H.R. 211, led by @RepSchrader, would reduce the rate of pay for Members of Congress if a shutdown occurs‚Äî because if the House, in concert with the Senate and POTUS, cannot keep our government open, officials shouldn‚Äôt expect a full taxpayer-funded paycheck until they do.

H.R. 67, led by @RepDonBeyer, is a bipartisan bill that would require that federal employees unpaid during the shutdown would receive their pay once the shutdown ends. The havoc caused by the shutdown is bad enough, but ensuring federal employees receive their salaries is vital.

These two bills would make sure: 

1. Federal workers receive backpay once the shutdown ends, and 

2. Member of Congress don't receive their regular salaries in a shutdown.

And because I feel strongly that federal employees and the very function of our government should not be bargaining chips, on my first day in Congress, I also co-sponsored two bills that would help address this increasingly serious situation.

On my first day in Congress, I voted for, and the House passed, legislation with bipartisan support that would have funded the government and ended the shutdown, but so far, the Senate will not take it up.
